data.title: Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie
data.meta_description: One of the most flexible and advanced indoor performance spaces in the United States, Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie is the first venue of its kind. Many touring artists have already called Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie "the theater of the future."
data.text:
Accessible Seat tickets are available for every AXS ticketed event through the normal purchase process. Instructions can be found on AXS website. Wheelchair accessible seats are located on row QQ of sections 202, 203, 204, 205, & 206. One companion is allowed per wheelchair seat. Accessible seating is also available in person at Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie box office. Handicap parking is located near the front of the venue. There is a handicap accessible ramp (front of the venue on the west side) that can be used for easy entry into the venue.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie and its food and beverage concessionaires have adopted an alcohol policy that is designed to protect guests and the community from alcohol-related incidents. Guests are expected to obey all state and local laws governing the purchase, possession, and consumption of alcohol. It is illegal for anyone under the age of 21 to consume alcoholic beverages. In addition, the following items are to be noted:

Alcoholic beverages will not be served in containers larger than 24 ounces.

There shall be a maximum limit of two alcoholic beverages sold to each guest, per purchase.

All guests who appear to be younger than the age of thirty-five (35) will be asked to show valid identification prior to being served alcoholic beverages.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie reserves the right to eject anyone under the age of twenty one (21) who is observed to be consuming alcohol on the premises or who appears to be visibly intoxicated.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie and its food and beverage concessionaires will implement ongoing responsible alcohol management training sessions for its serving staff.

For safety and as a courtesy to other guests, aisles and seating walkways must be kept clear at all times. Please follow the directions of the usher in your section to your assigned ticketed seat and refrain from standing in the aisles.

Animals or pets of any kind are prohibited with the exception of service animals for guests with disabilities and/or special needs. Services animals are welcomed into the building and must remain on a leash or harness at all times. If you intend to bring a service animal into the building, please contact the Guest Services department prior to your arrival.

There are several ATM locations at Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie. Two are on the east side of the lobby (to the left of the main bar) and another is on the west side of the lobby (to the right of the main bar).

Bags are not allowed to enter Texas Trust CU Theatre beginning January of 2022 to reduce touchpoints and congestion upon arrival. Exceptions may be made for:

Medical bags no larger than what is required to transport necessary medical equipment

Diaper bags for guests accompanied by infant(s)

Small, single compartment clutches no larger than 5x9 inches

PROHIBITED BAGS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

All purses, bags or containers larger than a small clutch bag

Backpacks

Binocular case â€“ Binoculars may be worn around the neck

Briefcases

Camera bags

Cinch bags

Computer bags

Fanny packs

Luggage of any kind

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie is committed to creating a safe, comfortable, and enjoyable entertainment experience.

Guests have a right to expect an environment where: Guests will be treated in a consistent, professional and courteous manner by all venue personnel.

Guests will enjoy every event free from disruptive behavior, including foul or abusive language or obscene gestures.

Guests will consume alcoholic beverages in a responsible manner. Intervention with an impaired, intoxicated or underage guests will be handled in a prompt and safe manner.

Guests will sit only in their ticketed seats and show their tickets when requested.

Guests who engage in fighting, throwing objects or attempting to enter the stage will be immediately ejected from the venue.

Guests will not smoke inside the venue. There are designated smoking areas on the east and west sides of the building.

There will not be any obscene or indecent messages on signs or clothing.

Guests will comply with requests from venue staff regarding facility operations and emergency response procedures.

Guests will also be responsible for their own good time by reporting inappropriate behavior.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie venue staff has been trained to intervene when deemed necessary and to use their best discretion to help ensure that guests who ignore the Code of Conduct do not interfere with other guests' ability to enjoy an event. Guests who violate the Code of Conduct may be subject to ejection without refund and, to the extent their conduct constitutes a violation of law, may be subject to arrest. We thank you for your cooperation.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie Guest Services welcomes all feedback, questions, and concerns from our guests. To contact us via e-mail, please fill out this form. Most e-mails will receive a return reply within 24 hours. If your question concerns the event on that day, please call us at (972) 854-5050.

All Guests must maintain reasonable and appropriate behavior at all times. Guests using offensive language or engaging in disorderly conduct may be ejected from the facility and may be subject to arrest. Ejected Guests will not receive a refund for their tickets or be compensated in any way for their loss. Disturbances include, but are not limited to, the following:

Standing on chairs

Drunk and disorderly conduct

Fighting or challenging others to fight

"Mooning" or exposing private body parts

Interference with or delay of the show/event

Violation of The Theatre at Grand Prairie event policies

Violation of the local, state, and federal laws and statues

Attempting to enter the stage or backstage areas without permission

Throw, discharge, or launch any liquid substance or objects

Willfully and maliciously disturbing another Guest / employee with loud and unreasonable noise

Using profanity and/or offensive words, which are likely to provoke a violent reaction from others

Taunting or using offensive language against the performers

The time the doors to Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie open will vary according to the event. Typically doors will open 1 hour prior to the event time noted on your ticket. Please also see the specific event page for more information by clicking on the Event Calendar.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie works on a continuing basis with the Grand Prairie City Fire Department, the Grand Prairie Police Department, and other agencies in the development of specific Emergency Procedures Plans for each event. Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie recognizes that its goal is to provide a safe, enjoyable atmosphere. The use of installed automated security systems, appropriate security operating plans, trained guest services and security personnel will ensure the security and safety of all guests, performers, and employees at Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie. In the case of an emergency, guests must comply with requests from venue staff regarding theatre operations and emergency response procedures.

Guests may not bring food and/or beverage items into the theatre during events. Glass bottles or metal cans are strictly prohibited. Guests must dispose of the unauthorized items prior to entrance into the theatre or return them to their vehicle. Guest Services will not check-in or store any food or beverage items. Guest with specific/special dietary needs due to medical conditions or religious requirements should contact the The Theatre at Grand Prairie Guest Services.

Our Guest Service Center is located near the main lobby doors and is designed to provide information to guests with questions, concerns, or issues during Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie events. In addition, the Guest Service Center provides assistance to Guests with disabilities (see Disabled Services). Should you have a question, comment, or concern before or after an event, please contact our Guest Services department.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie management assumes no responsibility for items lost at events. All lost and found items are to taken to the Guest Service Center during events. Guests should visit the Guest Service Center near the main lobby during the event to inquire about lost items. After the conclusion of the event, if the lost item is not retrieved, Guests may contact Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie at (972) 854-5050 to inquire about the lost item.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie has a "no re-entry" policy during events. Guests who wish to return a prohibited item to their vehicle or need to exit and re-enter due to personal emergencies, must first make contact with a Guest Services supervisor or manager via the Guest Service Center to make necessary arrangements.

Parking is open two hours prior to the start of each event. No overnight parking allowed. Tailgating, grilling, open flames, or consumption of alcoholic beverages are not permitted. Parking fees are typically $30 for General Lot, $50 for VIP/Suites Lot. Disabled parking spots are available in front of the building. There is a designated Drop Off location directly in front of the building. Parking is credit/debit only. No cash will be accepted. Parking is on a first come first serve basis.

Guests may not bring audio or video recording devices into Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie. These devices include, but are not limited to, video cameras/camcorders and audio recording devices. Any equipment not conforming to these rules must be removed from the premises or left with Guest Services near the main lobby during the event.

Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie is pleased to provide sign language interpretation for guests with hearing impairments. Requests for this service must be received at least 2 weeks prior to the event and may be arranged through our Guest Services department. Please contact Guest Services to arrange this service. Also see Disabled Services.

To purchase tickets to Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie events, and to inquire about ticket availability, please visit www.AXS.com or contact AXS via phone at 1-888-9-AXS-TIX (1-888-929-7849). The box office hours are Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11AM to 3PM and 2 hours before show time. AXS service charges apply at the box office the same as they do on the Internet.

Please bring a Photo ID, the credit card used for your purchase, and a confirmation number when picking tickets up at Will Call. In some cases, Will Call tickets may only be picked up on the day of an event.

The resale of tickets ("scalping") is against the law and will not be permitted in and around the property of Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie. Violators will be reported to the Grand Prairie Police Department. In addition, in accordance with the Grand Prairie Municipal code, guests may not sell their unused tickets to others in and around The Theatre at Grand Prairie.

Grand Prairie City Ordinance #6601 is "An ordinance prohibiting the sale or resale of items on the premises of a city owned or partially owned venue or facility or in the streets and public right of ways of the city" "It shall be unlawful to sell or to offer for sell or resale any item, product property or service including but not limited to tickets, passes, food, t-shirts and other souvenir merchandise reflecting likenesses, images, or other messages concerning performances or appearances at the venue or any non-related event" "Sale or resale of items on the premises or in the streets and other public rights of way within 5000 feet of City owned or partially owned venues."

To avoid problems with counterfeit, stolen or voided tickets, Guests should make your purchases through authorized outlets only.

Except as otherwise required by law, guests are prohibited from bringing weapons into the theatre. Texas Trust CU Theatre at Grand Prairie does not provide weapon lockers. Weapons may not be checked in at Guest Services. Weapons include, but are not limited to, the following: Firearms, explosives, stun guns, handcuffs, brass knuckles, sticks, clubs, batons, martial arts instruments, pepper spray, tear gas, and knives.
